name: Healthy & Delicious: Sausage, Apple, and Cranberry Stuffing
description: Editor's note: On Mondays, Kristen Swensson of Cheap, Healthy, Good swings by these parts to share healthy and delicious recipes with us. Who knew stuffing could be healthy? Take it away, Kristen! [Photograph: Kristen Swensson] There are certain times in...
recipeIngredient: 10 ounces sweet Italian turkey sausage (about 3 links)
2 1/2 medium Granny Smith apples, cored and chopped (NOT peeled)
1/2 cup dried cranberries, rehydrated in boiling water for 15 minutes and drained
6 cups good whole wheat bread cubes
1 1/2 to 2 cups reduced sodium, low-fat chicken stock

recipeInstructions.text: Remove sausage from casings. Sauté in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until browned (about 10 minutes), breaking it up as it cooks. Spoon cooked sausage into a large mixing bowl. Melt butter in skillet. Add onion, apples, celery, and poultry seasoning, and saute until onions are soft, about 8 minutes. Kill the heat and stir in cranberries, sage, and rosemary. Pour into bowl with sausage. Add bread cubes and parsley and stir to combine. Gradually pour in broth, stirring until everything is moist (but not sopping). Season with salt and pepper.
Pour stuffing into 9x13 baking dish and bake 20 to 30 minutes, until top is browned and middle is hot. Serve to numerous rounds of applause.
